revisions.content:
[[Marik Ishtar|Marik]] plays a variety of Decks while controlling the bodies of various individuals through the [[Millennium Rod]]. Marik's main deck is never seen in the anime and manga. Once his body is taken over by [[Yami Marik]], he creates a new deck. For those Decks, see [[Yami Marik's Decks]].

==Anime==
===Through Keith===
{| style="float:right; margin-bottom:5px;" border="1" width="50%"
! colspan="3" style="background: #00FF00; text-align: center;" | Record
|-
! Opponent(s)
! Episode(s)
! Outcome
|-
|[[Yugi Muto]] || [[Yu-Gi-Oh! - Episode 050|50]]-[[Yu-Gi-Oh! - Episode 051|51]] || No result (possessing  [[Bandit Keith]])
|}

While controlling [[Bandit Keith]], he utilizes Keith's '''[[Machine]] Deck''', albeit modified to include powerful cards obtained by his [[Rare Hunter]]s, such as "[[Zera the Mant (anime)|Zera the Mant]]", "[[Seiyaryu (anime)|Seiyaryu]]" and "[[Graceful Charity (anime)|Graceful Charity]]".

{{Decklist|Machine Deck
|normal monsters =
* [[Ground Attacker Bugroth (anime)|Ground Attack Bugroth]] x2<ref group=Notes name=hand2>The second copy can be seen in his hand after the first is [[Tribute]]d for "[[Zera Ritual (anime)|Zera Ritual]]" in [[Yu-Gi-Oh! - Episode 051|episode 51]].</ref>
* [[Mechanicalchaser (anime)|Mechancialchaser]]
* [[Megasonic Eye (anime)|Megasonic Eye]]
* [[Seiyaryu (anime)|Seiyaryu]]
|effect monsters = 
* [[Cyber Jar (anime)|Cyber Jar]] 
* [[Machine King (anime)|Machine King]]
|ritual monsters = 
* [[Zera the Mant (anime)|Zera the Mant]]
|magic =
* [[Curse of Fiend (anime)|Curse of Fiend]]
* [[Graceful Charity (anime)|Graceful Charity]] 
* [[Machine Conversion Factory (anime)|Machine Conversion Factory]]
* [[Stop Defense (anime)|Stop Defense]]
* [[Tribute to the Doomed (anime)|Tribute to the Doomed]]
* [[Zera Ritual (anime)|Zera Ritual]]
|traps =
* [[Magic Jammer (anime)|Magic Jammer]]
* [[Solemn Judgment (anime)|Solemn Judgment]]
}}

===Through Strings===
{| style="float:right; margin-bottom:5px;" border="1" width="50%"
! colspan="3" style="background: #00FF00; text-align: center;" | Record
|-
! Opponent(s)
! Episode(s)
! Outcome
|-
|[[Yugi Muto]]/[[Yami Yugi]] || [[Yu-Gi-Oh! - Episode 065|65]]-[[Yu-Gi-Oh! - Episode 067|67]] || Lose (possessing [[Strings]])
|}

While controlling the body of [[Strings]], Marik uses a '''[[Slifer the Sky Dragon (anime)|Slifer]]/[[Slime]] Deck''' tooled to Summoning and powering up the [[Egyptian Gods|Egyptian God Card]] "[[Slifer the Sky Dragon (anime)|Slifer the Sky Dragon]]" using a five-card combo known as the '''"God Five"''':

* "[[Slifer the Sky Dragon (anime)|Slifer the Sky Dragon]]": The main attack force with near infinite attack power.
* "[[Revival Jam (anime)|Revivial Jam]]": The ultimate defense, to defend "Slifer" if necessary.
* "[[Jam Defender (anime)|Jam Defender]]": To allow "Revival Jam" to automatically defend "Slifer".
* "[[Card of Safe Return (anime)|Card of Safe Return]]": Every time "Revival Jam" is [[Special Summon]]ed from the [[Graveyard]], Strings must draw three cards, and "Slifer" gains 3000 ATK.
* "[[Infinite Cards (anime)|Infinite Cards]]": Removes hand limit, allowing the ATK of "Slifer" to climb virtually infinite.

However, despite Marik's claim that this combo would allow "Slifer" to have infinite ATK, Yami Yugi proved otherwise, as he [[Brain Control|brainwashed]] "Revival Jam" and had "Slifer" constantly attack the reviving monster, forcing Strings to keep drawing until a [[Deck Out]] occurred, thus losing. Therefore, this combo's greatest weakness is the ATK of "Slifer" is limited by the number of cards within the player's Deck.

{{clear}}

{{Decklist|Slifer Deck
|normal monsters =
* [[Humanoid Slime (anime)|Humanoid Slime]] x2 <ref group=Notes name=hand1>A second copy can be seen in the anime after Strings drops his hand while Yami is explaining his infinite loop combo in [[Yu-Gi-Oh! - Episode 057|episode 57]].</ref>
* [[Slime King]]<ref group=Notes name=manga1>This card was only used in the manga.</ref>
* [[Worm Drake (anime)|Worm Drake]] x2 <ref group=Notes name=hand1/>
|effect monsters = 
* [[Revival Jam (anime)|Revival Jam]] 
* [[Slifer the Sky Dragon (anime)|Slifer the Sky Dragon]]
|fusion monsters = 
* [[Humanoid Worm Drake (anime)|Humanoid Worm Drake]]
|magic =
* [[Card of Safe Return (anime)|Card of Safe Return]] x2
* [[Infinite Cards (anime)|Infinite Cards]]
* [[Jam Breeding Machine (anime)|Jam Breeding Machine]] x2
* [[Nightmare's Steelcage (anime)|Nightmare's Steelcage]]
* [[Polymerization (anime)|Polymerization]]<ref group=Notes name=artwork1>The artwork of this card was that of "[[De-Fusion (anime)|De-Fusion]]" in the dub.</ref>
* [[Pot of Greed (anime)|Pot of Greed]]<ref group=Notes name=anime1>This card was only used in the anime.</ref>
* [[Quick Attack]]
|traps =
* [[Jam Defender (anime)|Jam Defender]]
}}

===Through Joey===
{| style="float:right; margin-bottom:5px;" border="1" width="50%"
! colspan="3" style="background: #00FF00; text-align: center;" | Record
|-
! Opponent(s)
! Episode(s)

|-
|[[Yugi Muto]]/[[Yami Yugi]] || [[Yu-Gi-Oh! - Episode 075|75]]-[[Yu-Gi-Oh! - Episode 078|78]] || [[DRAW]] (Duel taken over by [[Joey Wheeler]])
|}

While controlling [[Joey Wheeler]], Marik plays a modified version of Joey's own Deck, which includes cards that are banned by [[Battle City Rules]], such as "[[Hinotama (anime)|Hinotama]]", "[[Raigeki (anime)|Raigeki]]" and "[[Meteor of Destruction (anime)|Meteor of Destruction]]".

{{Decklist|Joey's Deck
|normal monsters =
* [[Alligator's Sword (anime)|Alligator's Sword]]
|effect monsters = 
* [[Gearfried the Iron Knight (anime)|Gearfried the Iron Knight]] (in hand)
* [[Panther Warrior (anime)|Panther Warrior]]
* [[Rocket Warrior (anime)|Rocket Warrior]]
|magic =
* [[Attrition]]
* [[Graceful Dice (anime)|Graceful Dice]]
* [[Hinotama (anime)|Hinotama]] x3
* [[Meteor of Destruction (anime)|Meteor of Destruction]]
* [[Raigeki (anime)|Raigeki]]
* [[Skull Dice (anime)|Skull Dice]]<ref group=Notes name=trapasspell>This card was played as a [[Spell Card|Magic Card]]. It was depicted as a [[Trap Card]] in the dub. It is a Trap Card in the ''TCG''/''OCG''.</ref>
|traps =
* [[Magical Arm Shield (anime)|Magical Arm Shield]]
}}

==Video games==
===Dark Duel Stories===
As the box art suggests, Marik is one of the final opponents in the game, and can only be unlocked after beating Yami Yugi 5 times and entering a code.

Marik's Deck consists of various rare and powerful cards, including many of the best cards in the game. A few of his cards were used by Bandit Keith in the anime under his possession.

{{Decklist
|normal monsters =
* [[The Bistro Butcher]] x3
* [[Dark Elf]] x3

}}

===7 Trials to Glory: World Championship 2005===
In ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! 7 Trials to Glory: World Championship 2005]]'', Marik plays a [[One Turn Kill]] [[Deck]] centered around the abuse of [[Forbidden]] cards.

{{Decklist
|normal monsters =
* [[Summoned Skull]] x3
|effect monsters =
* [[Banisher of the Light]] x3
* [[Black Luster Soldier - Envoy of the Beginning]] x3
* [[Chaos Emperor Dragon - Envoy of the End]] x3
|spells =
* [[Card Destruction]] x3
* [[Dark Hole]] x3
* [[Graceful Charity]] x3
* [[Mage Power]] x3
* [[Pot of Greed]] x3
* [[Raigeki]] x3
* [[Upstart Goblin]] x3
* [[United We Stand]] x3
|traps =
* [[Mirror Force]] x3
* [[Torrential Tribute]] x3
}}

'''Girag''' is a [[Legendary Duelist]] in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links]]''. This is a video game depiction of [[Girag]], a character from the ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! ZEXAL]]'' anime.

Yellow [[Gate Key]]s are required to Duel Girag at the [[Gate]].

He appears in-game after the player reaches Stage 6 of Duel World (ZEXAL), at which point his Character Unlock Missions become available. Prior to April 4, 2023, he could only be unlocked in the [[List of Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Links events|special event]] ''[[The Friendship Games: Girag Appears!]]''.

==Description==
{{Quote|One of the [[Seven Barian Emperors]] sworn to destroy [[Astral World]]. Unable to use his true powers in the human world, he mind controls Duelists to collect [[Numbers]] for him. When fighting in his [[Barian]] Form, he crushes his foes with "[[Number 106: Giant Hand (Duel Links)|Number 106: Giant Hand]]".}}
<!--@@Do not edit. This is an official description from the game.@@-->

==Dialogue==
{{Incomplete}}
===Character-specific===
===Card-specific===
;Monsters

* When Girag Summons "[[Number 106: Giant Hand (Duel Links)|Number 106: Giant Hand]]", a cut-in frame of Girag briefly appears, and he announces"Grrrr... Crush the world in your mighty fist! Number 106: Giant Hand!"  If that player hasn't already Summoned "Number 106: Giant Hand" during that Duel, a cutscene of "Number 106: Giant Hand" being Summoned plays afterward.
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "Giant Hand attacks!" or "Giant Hand! Smash 'em!"
**When Girag activates the effect of that monster, he announces "I activate Number 106: Giant Hand's effect!" followed by "Upper Hand Drillbit Demise! Your monster's less than useless!"

* When Girag Summons "[[Number C106: Giant Red Hand (Duel Links)|Number C106: Giant Red Hand]]" he chants, "'''''It has the power to harness this chaotic world! Its fist will smash the land! Its fingers will tear the sky! I have to give up my own strength to control this monster, but I'm willing to make that sacrifice!'''''" followed by "'''''Chaos Xyz Evolution! Come forth! Chaos Number 106!'''''" Afterwards, he announces"Chaos Number 106: Giant Red Hand!"
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "Giant Red Hand, attack!" followed by "Onslaught Spiral!"
**When Girag activates the effect of that monster, he makes one of the following announcements:
*** "Giant Red Hand, activate your effect! Use 1 Chaos Overlay Unit to negate all other face-up cards!"
*** "No matter what you try, Giant Red Hand will crush it!" followed by "Heavy Handed Hurricane!"

* When Girag Summons "[[Number 58: Burner Visor (Duel Links)|Number 58: Burner Visor]]", a cut-in frame of Girag briefly appears, and he announces "Set this Duel on fire! Number 58: Burner Visor!"
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "Burner Visor! Attack!"
**When Girag activates the effect of that monster, he announces "I activate Burner Visor's effect!"

*When Girag Summons "[[Number 64: Ronin Raccoon Sandayu (Duel Links)|Number 64: Ronin Raccoon Sandayu]]" he chants, "'''''Let's go, Number 64! The wisdom to confuse the world!'''''" Afterwards, a cut-in frame of Girag briefly appears, and he announces "Ronin Raccoon Sandayu!"
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "Ronin Raccoon Sandayu! Attack!"
**When Girag activates the effect of that monster, he announces "I use 1 Overlay Unit to play Ronin Racoon Sandayu's effect!"

* When Girag Summons "[[Fire Hand (Duel Links)|Fire Hand]]", a cut-in frame of Girag's face briefly appears, and he announces "Argh... Come out, Fire Hand! Aaargh..."
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "Fire Hand! Attack!"
**When Girag activates the effect of that monster, he announces "When Fire Hand is destroyed, its effect activates! It destroys your monster and Special Summons Ice Hand!"

* When Girag Summons "[[Ice Hand (Duel Links)|Ice Hand]]" a cut-in frame of Girag's face briefly appears, and he announces "Go, Ice Hand! Ergh... Aaaagh!"
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "Attack! Ice Hand!"
**When Girag activates the effect of that monster, he announces "When Ice Hand is destroyed, its effect activates! It destroys a Spell or Trap and Special Summons Fire Hand!"

* When Girag Summons "[[Magic Hand (Duel Links)|Magic Hand]]" a cut-in frame of Girag's face briefly appears, and he announces "Here's Magic Hand!"
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "Attack, Magic Hand!"
**When Girag activates the effect of that monster, he announces "Magic Hand's effect activates! Get rid of the card you got and take damage!"

* When Girag Summons "[[Prominence Hand (Duel Links)|Prominence Hand]]", a cut-in frame of Girag's face briefly appears, and he announces "Come on out! Prominence Hand! Ergggh..."
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "Prominence Hand attacks!"

*When Girag Summons "[[Baby Raccoon Ponpoko (Duel Links)|Baby Raccoon Ponpoko]]" he announces "Baby Raccoon Ponpoko!"
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "Baby Raccoon Ponpoko! Attack!"
**When Girag activates the effect of that monster, he announces "When Baby Raccoon Ponpoko is Summoned, its effect activates! I Special Summon a Level 2 Beast from my deck in defense!"

* When Girag Summons "[[Baby Raccoon Tantan (Duel Links)|Baby Raccoon Tantan]]" he announces "Baby Raccoon Tantan!"
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "Baby Raccoon Tantan! Attack!"
**When Girag activates the effect of that monster, he announces "Baby Raccoon Tantan's effect activates when it's flipped! I Special Summon a Level 2 Beast from my deck!"

*When Girag Summons "[[Chu-Ske the Mouse Fighter (Duel Links)|Chu-Ske the Mouse Fighter]]" he announces "Chu-Ske the Mouse Fighter!"
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "Chu-Ske the Mouse Fighter! Strike 'em hard, little guy!"

*When Girag Summons "[[Kagemusha Raccoon Token (Duel Links)|Kagemusha Raccoon Token]]" he announces "I Special Summon a Kagemusha Racoon Token!"
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "My Kagemusha Raccoon Token attacks!"

* When Girag Summons "[[Koa'ki Meiru Powerhand (Duel Links)|Koa'ki Meiru Powerhand]]" he announces "Koa'ki Meiru Powerhand!"
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "Koa'ki Meiru Powerhand! Attack!"

*When Girag Summons "[[Master Monk (Duel Links)|Master Monk]]" he announces "Master Monk!"
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "Master Monk attacks!"

* When Girag Summons "[[Monk Fighter (Duel Links)|Monk Fighter]]" he announces "Monk Fighter!"
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "Monk Fighter! Attack!"

* When Girag Summons "[[The Judgement Hand (Duel Links)|The Judgement Hand]]" he announces "The Judgement Hand!"
** Most of the time when Girag declares an attack with that monster, he announces "The Judgement Hand! Pound 'em!"

;Spells/Traps

* When Girag activates "[[Kaminote Blow (Duel Links)|Kaminote Blow]]" he announces "I activate my Spell Card, Kaminote Blow! Get your monster outta here!"

* When Girag activates "[[Memory Loss (Duel Links)|Memory Loss]]" he announces "This'll come in handy! I activate my Trap! Memory Loss!"

* When Girag activates "[[Rank-Up-Magic Barian's Force (Duel Links)|Rank-Up-Magic Barian's Force]]" he announces "I activate Rank-Up-Magic Barian's Force!"

* When Girag activates "[[Reload (Duel Links)|Reload]]" he announces "I activate my Quick-Play Spell, Reload! I return my hand to my Deck, and then draw the same amount!"

* When Girag activates "[[Rocket Hand (Duel Links)|Rocket Hand]]" he announces "I activate my Trap! Rocket Hand! I equip this card on a monster!"
** When activating the effect of that card, Girag announces "The equipped Rocket Hand's effect activates! By sending this card to the Graveyard, I can destroy a card!"

[[File:DuelTriangleFusion/Synchro/Xyz.png|thumb|Duel Triangle Fusion/Synchro/Xyz]]

'''Duel Triangle Fusion/Synchro/Xyz''' is an event that took place in ''[[Yu-Gi-Oh! Master Duel]]'' from April 18, 2024 through April 30, 2024.

== Event details ==
This event [[Duel Triangle Fusion/Synchro/Xyz Lists|limited]] players to only using exclusively [[Fusion Monster]]s, [[Synchro Monster]]s, or [[Xyz Monster]]s in the [[Extra Deck]] with some restrictions on burn and floodgate cards.  

During this event, the player can earn Points by Dueling using a Loaner Deck or their own Deck. The player earns more Points when they win and less Points when they lose. No Points are earned if the player surrenders.

Players are given rewards based on the number of Medals collected, including a Protector, Title, [[Gem (Master Duel)|Gems]], and [[Legacy Pack ticket]]s.

pages.title: Fear the Might of My Fist!

revisions.content:
{{Duel Links Skill | ja_name = | romaji_name = | lore = At the beginning of the Duel, add 1 "[[Battlin' Boxer Switchitter (Duel Links)|Battlin' Boxer Switchitter]]" and 1 "[[Battlin' Boxer Headgeared (Duel Links)|Battlin' Boxer Headgeared]]" to your Deck, unless it already includes three copies of the respective card. Then, add 1 "[[Number 105: Battlin' Boxer Star Cestus (Duel Links)|Number 105: Battlin' Boxer Star Cestus]]" to your Extra Deck.
The following effect can be used if your Life Points are at 2000 or below. Return 1 card from your hand to your Deck and add 1 "[[Rank-Up-Magic Barian's Force (Duel Links)|Rank-Up-Magic Barian's Force]]" to your hand from outside of your Deck.
This Skill can only be used once per Duel. | ja_lore = | releases = {{Duel Links Skill release table|type=level_up|Alito (Duel Links)|Level 1}} | supports = * Battlin' Boxer Switchitter (Duel Links) * Battlin' Boxer Headgeared (Duel Links) * Number 105: Battlin' Boxer Star Cestus (Duel Links) * Rank-Up-Magic Barian's Force (Duel Links) | misc = Only once per Duel }}
